style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Levante Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Levante started as many home brewing dreams start; the mission to create the perfect beer in a three gallon pot in the kitchen of a small apartment. Eric and Tim quickly realized that this is an excercise in futility, but along the way, their steadfast persistence and the quest to make a truly satisfying beer has resulted in countless hours of research and experimentation. While the small 5 gallon batches allowed for plenty of great experience, they yearned for more creative control.

The brewers decided it was time for a more professional three vessel system, giving them complete control over the brewing process. The 1/2 barrel system gave the brewers a solid platform to refine and perfect a lineup of beers for the most discerning pallet. This led to the creation of several great recipes, and a roster of clean crisp beers. The original hobby transformed into a passion for sharing world-class hand crafted beers with those who would appreciate them. 

Levante Brewing currently brews on our 15 bbl production brewery system located in West Chester, PA. We are servicing several local restaurants, pubs and distributers. Levante aims to deliver a variety of creative brews to beer lovers in Philadelphia's western suburbs and beyond.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description:
The classic Gaffel Koelsch is a particularly fresh speciality beer from Cologne, brewed according to a time-honoured family recipe and the German Purity Law of 1516 with water, malt, hops, and hops extract.

The delicately bitter, pleasant, slightly hopsy taste is characteristic of this traditional product and clearly distinguishes Gaffel Koelsch from all other Koelsch brands.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: Our golden ale is brewed to refresh on the hottest of days. Premium European and honey malts with German hops. If you need an answer to the Texas heat, this crisp German classic is it!

breweries.name: Redwood Brewing Co
breweries.description: Brewpub that offers upscale dining in a casual atmosphere. Our lodge themed restaurant features: smoke free dining, award winning beer, woodfire pizza oven, steaks, wild game, live music, outdoor dining and much more. 2008 Great American Beer Fest Small Brewpub of the Year.

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: Light in color and alcohol, this beer style originates in Cologne, Germany.  Quintessential Kolsch beers have an almost Cheerio aroma with green apple or pear rounding out the aroma.  Flavor is crisp and clean with a hint of fruity sweetness.

breweries.name: Liquid Mechanics Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Liquid Mechanics Brewing Co. is a small yet mighty, neighborhood craft brewery in Lafayette, Colorado. We believe that great beer is honest and doesn't cut corners, it connects people to the things that matter, and — sometimes — a little rebellion is good for the soul. Cheers!

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: Kölsch is a German style lager that is crisp and refreshing. The hoppiness is prominent but not extreme and is less bitter than a standard German pale lager.

breweries.nameShortDisplay: Lexington Brewing Company and Wine House
breweries.description:
Think Globally, Drink Locally

Located in historic Lexington, MI the winery offers many award winning wines AND CRAFT BEER for samples, by the glass, and by the bottle. Wine makers Connie Currie and Steven Velloff have created a warm and inviting atmosphere  "Where the past meets the present and good friends come to meet."

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: The Kölsch beer was born in Cologne (Köln), Germany, and rides the line between an ale and a lager. Attempting to make a lager, historic conditions prevented the Kölsch beer from fermenting cool enough to qualify as a true lager. Our version drinks like a German Pils or Pale Lager, but with less bitterness and a slight fruitiness imparted by the unique yeast strain. Bright, straw-yellow, and smooth, Kölsch is a perfect summer lawnmower beer. Available draft only until we’ve had enough, which may be awhile…

breweries.name: Zipline Brewing Co.
breweries.description: Proudly headquartered in Lincoln, Nebraska, Zipline Brewing Company was borne out of our passion for locally produced craft beer. Visit this page and our website at www.ziplinebrewing.com to learn more about our company and the beers we produce. You can also follow us on Twitter and Untappd. Cheers!

breweries.name: Bloomington Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Philosophy—
Life without labor is guilt. 
Labor without art is brutality—John Rusgan

There is a nearly infinite variety of ways to make good beer. At the Bloomington Brewing Company, we make beers that we like to drink. That’s the first rule. Great ingredients and attention to detail is the second. Our intention is not to grow a large brewery operation, our intention is to make great beer that we like to drink and to take care of our community.

We make only ales and they are available only on draft in Bloomington, Indianapolis and the surrounding communities. We do not bottle our beers. We’re not against bottling, and we will assuredly reach a point in the future where we will package our beer, but no matter how good a beer is in the bottle, it can never be better than the beer coming from a well managed tap. Often it will be not nearly as good. Why? Draft beer is fresher; that’s a big one. Packaging beer is a complicated process with lots of potential for bad things to happen. Once packaged, the beer is exposed to its two mortal enemies; Sunlight and time.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: In Cologne, Germany, many a brewery produces a light-bodied ale with a delicate fruitiness and rounded maltiness, attributable to the unique yeast strain commonly used. Our Kölsch is unfiltered and more generously hopped than its German cousin.

breweries.name: Double Mountain Brewery
breweries.description:
Matt Swihart and Charlie Devereux founded Double Mountain in 2007 with a clear mission: make great beer for craft beer fans. Ours is a "brewers' brewery", with an uncompromising focus on beer quality.

 From the beginning, our goal was to make beers that we liked to drink. All of our beers are served up unfiltered and long-aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. The beers can be very complex and assertive, but with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We aim to satisfy both the hardcore aficionados and the more casual craft beer fan, all in the same glass.

 In June of 2013, Matt purchased Charlie's shares of Double Mountain, vowing to continue the good work the two partners created.

hops.name: Perle (American)
hops.description: Bred in Germany from Northern Brewer, Perle was an attempt at a higher-alpha replacement for Hallertauer Mittelfr?her. It has a pleasant aroma with a minty character. American versions have a very different profile than those grown in Germany.

malt.name: Munich Malt
malt.description: Munich Malt has a malty sweet flavor characteristic and adds a reddish amber color to the beer. It has enough diastatic power to convert itself, but needs help from another malt, such as 2-row malt, to convert other grains.

characteristics.name: Malty
characteristics.description: Imparts a malty flavor upon the beer.

characteristics.name: Sweet
characteristics.description: Imparts a sweet flavor upon the beer.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: Pale yellow in color, and pours with a persistent frothy white head. Carries delicate herbal aromas, with hints of pineapple pear, and green apple, with a crisp yet smooth maltiness. Brewed with Weyermann Pilsner and Pale malt, Northern Brewer and Spalt hops, and our proprietary German ale yeast strain.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). breweries.name: Redwood Curtain Brewing
breweries.description:
We desire to share our passion and interest in craft beer with everyone from the first time sipper to the seasoned enthusiast. Providing academic and hands on experiences are a big part of this desire to help people expand and trust their own senses.

All of our handcrafted artisan ales are served and properly aged, to deliver maximum flavor and character. Our expressive beers can be very complex and assertive, but the with the ultimate goal of proper balance. We only use premium domestic and imported malts and hops, Humboldt County water and our multiply yeast strains. You will not find any artificial additives or preservatives in our beers.

We trust that our craft beer and brewing techniques convey our philosophies concerning family, friends, community, education and living life to its fullest. Cheers!

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: Gentle, Slightly Fruity, Complex Undertones of Malt, Refreshing

breweries.name: Chuckanut Brewery
breweries.description: Chuckanut Brewery makes award winning European style lagers and ales. Chuckanut Brewery & Kitchen at 601 West Holly St, Bellingham, full service pub, was awarded the National Small Brewpub/Brewer of the Year 2009 and National Small Brewery/Brewer of the Year 2011 at the Great American Beer Festival (GABF). Chuckanut Brewery South Nut Tap Room in the heart of Skagit Valley, 11937 Higgins Airport Way, Burlington welcomes guests of all ages since 2016. Check out additional information about Chuckanut Brewery at http://www.chuckanutbrewery.com/

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: The Kolsch is a classic German Ale, perfect for the summer.  This beer is mild all around- not a lot of malt, not a lot of hops.   Our current variant, the Kolkata, uses Indian spices such as coriander and cardamom, and pairs nicely with spicy food.

breweries.name: Milkman Brewing
breweries.description:
Milkman Brewing is a collection of local home brewers that found each other and decided to combine forces to offer locally made artisan beer for Pittsburgh and the surrounding areas!

Our goal is to become a licensed boutique brewery so we can make specialty local beer for private and public events.

We love that Pittsburgh is a city full of thriving small businesses, fantastic local eateries, and beautiful art. It is our hope to someday be known as one of the things that makes our city unique and wonderful!

data.name: KOLSCH
data.description: Hale’s version of this traditional German light ale won a Gold Medal at the Great American Beer Festival in 2010! It is similar to pilsner in flavor, light, subtle and thirst quenching. Hale's Kolsch is available all year round on draft; it is our designated "Spring/Summer" seasonal beer in 12oz. bottles.

breweries.name: Hales Ales Brewery and Pub
breweries.description:
Founded by Mike Hale in 1983, Hale's Ales is the Northwest's 3rd oldest and longest running independently owned brewery in the Northwest. Hale's built its long standing reputation by brewing small batch, full flavored ales using traditional English brewing methods.

An innovator from the start, Hale's was the first craft brewery to introduce Seasonal, Cask Conditioned and Nitrogen Conditioned ales to the region. Hale's goal is to stay true to what the craft brewing "revolution" is all about: crafting fresh, locally brewed ales of the very finest quality. Cheers from Hale's Ales!

breweries.name: Chattanooga Brewing Company
breweries.description: Chattanooga Brewing Company opened in 1890 and lasted until 1915 and was the choice of beer drinkers in Chattanooga, selling beer in most of the local taverns and in cases of bottles. Among their brands of the day were Imperial Pilsner and Magnolia. Returning to the local beer scene in 2010, they have brought back Imperial Pilsner and many other tasty brews. Many German, English, and American styles are featured throughout the year.

breweries.name: Missouri Beer Company
breweries.description: Based in O'Fallon MO

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: Thirst quenching, crisp, with a dry finish, this German Ale (pronounced Cœllsh) is the local brew of the city of Cologne (“Köln” in German). It is one of the palest German beers made and is considered Germany's answer to the British pale ale. Utilizing German malted barley from a malt-house situated outside Köln and dry hopped with outstanding Hallertau Mittelfrueh hops, this light bodied golden beer is oak aged (lagered) for six weeks on French Oak.

breweries.name: Bobcat Cafe & Brewery
breweries.description:
Located at the heart of the Green Mountains, we have the unique pleasure of serving handcrafted beers along side homemade food that is fresh and creative. Our brewmaster, Mark Magiera, uses high quality grains, hops and yeast strains to create up to a dozen true to style beers. With his unending expertise, Mark is passionate and innovative without losing the tradition behind each style. In the kitchen, we work hard to bring consistency and quality to the table. We focus on local ingredients to enhance our creative comfort food.

The Bobcat Cafe and Brewery opened ten years ago as a community supported business. Today, we strive to support and enhance the community by hosting benefit dinners and by providing a comfortable spot where local people can meet and socialize. Our 100 member Mug Club is a testament to the dedication of our regulars.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: A delicious example of this German classic. Medium body, light straw in color with a creamy head. Mild hops presence and dry fruity finish make this a perfect beer for tailgating season.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: River Dog Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 2012 by the Gray Family, River Dog Brewing has managed to make a splash in the rising tide of the Southern craft beer scene. Under the direction of Head Brewer Amelia Keefe, we’ve created an exceptional menu of beers, from Belgian ales to sours to one of the largest barrel aging programs in the South.
When you visit the South Carolina Lowcountry, you know that it’s more than just a place. It’s a way of life. Incredible people. Amazing food. Exceptional beer – brewed in Bluffton.

data.name: KÖlsch
data.description: This beer style originates in Köln, Germany and is very well known for being lighter bodied, slightly hazy, crisp and refreshing.  It is fermented with an ale yeast that acts similar to a lager yeast and performs well in lower temperatures.  To further enhance the crisp qualities imparted by this unique yeast, we use wheat as part of the grain bill and the slightly spicy and crisp German Tetnang hops.  All in all an easy drinking, very thirst quenching beer, perfect for a day in the sun or paired with a light flavored fish.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch

This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: A traditional German Ale from the city of Köln, this style provides the best of both worlds. It has the light body and easy drinking characteristics of a lager but backs it up with the malt complexity of an ale. Inspired by our brother Jon and our love for sessionable beer.

breweries.name: Cogstone Brewing Company
breweries.description: Cogstones are an ancient artifact from the American Southwest. They have been found along the Santa Ana River and some are believed to date from 3500 BC. Chemical evidence of fermented barley, coincidentally, has been found dating to around the same time. The Cogstone's function remains an enigma like the origin of ancient beer. No one knows exactly how beer was invented, but the process has been evolving ever since. We ,at cogstone, are more than just another "cog" in the quest to produce the perfect pint. Using history and the senses, our goal is to produce classic styles with a twist of the new. The resultant product will approach the upper limits on the continuum of perfection.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: This bier is delicate and pale with less bitterness than a Pils and less sweetness than a Helles. A subtle fruitiness is the hallmark of this classic style from Köln. Along with Alt, this is one of the last ale holdouts in Germany

breweries.name: Prost Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Brewery was made by the Ziemann GmbH in 1963. It was installed at the Bucher Bräu in the German city of Grafenau and used there until 1984. In 1984 it was overhauled and sold to Brauerei Hümmer of Breitengüßbach, Germany, a village in the Franconian region of Bavaria.

Brauerei Hümmer started brewing beer in the Franconian village of Breitengüßbach in 1642. The brewery served the town for over 350 years until the spring of 2011. It made several styles including Altfränkisches Dunkel Bier, a rare specialty beer that we will revive in Denver.

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: Covington Kolsch is the beer our brewery was founded on. Is very easy drinking wheat ale with a slight citrus flavor and aroma from the German noble hops it is brewed with. It is fermented at higher ale temperatures then cold conditioned like most lagers so you get the best of both worlds. A fruity aroma like an ale with a crisp, clean finish like a lager.
data.foodPairings: Pairs with: chicken, salads, salmon, bratwurst, hot dogs, burgers, seafood, boiled crawfish and shrimp

They use a fifteen barrel system to brew six standard house ales and a steady stream of specialty beers.

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: The kolsch is light in color and has a bouquet of lemon and wheat. The style is clean and has light, bready malt tones. A laid back bitterness finishes the beer, making it a refreshing and affable pint.

breweries.description: Blue Ghost Brewing Company aims to make world-class beer while being a community center in Fletcher, promoting family, worthy causes, & our local natural wonders.

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: Our Kolsch is a bright, light-bodied, moderately hopped golden ale/lager hybrid beer. We ferment and age it at lower temperatures than most of our ales to make it especially smooth, clean and refreshing. "Crisp" and "spritzy" are words that might come to mind when you try it.

breweries.name: Six Row Brewing Company
breweries.description: Six Row Brewing Company produces quality ales from the site of the old Falstaff Brewery at 3690 Forest Park Ave., in the Midtown area of St. Louis, near St. Louis University. Our Old Plant No. 1 Pub is open to the public and features our craft brewed beers along with selections from other craft breweries and wineries. Stop by and enjoy a pint soon! Then, take home a growler to enjoy one of St. Louis' finest craft beers till your next visit!

breweries.name: Wolf's Ridge Brewing
breweries.description:
A family owned and operated craft brewery and restaurant, created as a result of our long and deepening love for both craft beer and food. WRB was born through the deep desire of the owners to create a gathering space for other craft beer and food lovers in the downtown Columbus community. Our goal is to build a microbrewery and restaurant that becomes a proud member of the community, where we provide our patrons with the best possible dining and drinking experience.

Our wonderful staff and team strive to offer the highest quality craft beer and a casual, comfortable restaurant environment inspired by a new American menu featuring fresh and seasonal ingredients.

Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Bull & Bush Pub & Brewery
breweries.description:
In 1971, casting aside their stockbroker careers to become the bellwether personalities of the Denver restaurant industry in the 70s and 80s, the brothers built the Bull & Bush to kick start a list of successful restaurants.

Last but certainly not least, the pub is now also a brewery. Since brewing its first batch on New Year’s Day of 1997, the Bull & Bush brewing operation has become world renowned for its great tasting and innovative creations. Master Brewer Gabe Moline’s brews have earned multiple accolades including the Best Beer in a Brewpub award in Westword‘s Best of Denver, multiple awards at the annual Denver-hosted Great American Beer Festival (GABF) and most recently the Bull and Bush’s “The Legend of the Liquid Brain Imperial Stout” was given the highest honor, a Gold award, at the World Beer Cup – the world’s largest commercial beer competition.

breweries.name: Faultline Brewing #2

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: Noted for its golden color and mellow, delicate flavor, Kolsch is a style of beer originating in the German city of Koln. H.C. Berger uses pure Colorado Mountain Water to brew this soft ale, which bears a slightly fruity palate and a dry, hoppy finish. Kolsch goes splendidly with grilled whitefish, salmon, or delicate Thai or Vietnamese-inspired foods.

Chill haze should be absent.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Grixsen Brewing Co.
breweries.description:
Welcome to Grixsen Brewing. A Grixsen is defined as someone who believes in always giving an honest effort, to following the righteous path and to celebrate the uniqueness in everyone. 

We started with a passion for brewing and building a brand that could do something positive within the community. Our first batch was a holiday gift for friends and family grew to a full brewery in October 2015. Grixsen was founded by three friends - each lending a portion of his family name to create Grixsen. Our goal is to create iconic Northwest versions of traditional beer styles as well as the occasional celebration of the modern experimental craft movement.

data.name: Kolsch
data.description: A light-bodied, straw colored German ale as brewed in Cologne. Smooth with a nice, crisp finish.

style.name: German-Style Kölsch / Köln-Style Kölsch
style.description: Kölsch is warm fermented and aged at cold temperatures (German ale or alt-style beer). Kölsch is characterized by a golden to straw color and a slightly dry, subtly sweet softness on the palate, yet crisp. Good, dense head retention is desirable. Light pearapple-Riesling wine-like fruitiness may be apparent, but is not necessary for this style. Caramel character should not be evident. The body is light to medium-light. This beer has low hop flavor and aroma with medium bitterness. Wheat can be used in brewing this beer. Ale yeast is used for fermentation, though lager yeast is sometimes used in the bottle or final cold conditioning process. Fruity esters should be minimally perceived, if at all. Chill haze should be absent.

breweries.name: Taps Fish House & Brewery
breweries.description:
TAPS Fish House & Brewery was founded in 1999. Many of our beers reflect the classic brewing traditions of Europe, including England, Germany, and Belgium, while others are indicative of the creativity and innovation that are the hallmarks of the American Craft Beer scene.

TAPS’ repertoire of ales and lagers is highly varied and reflects a nod to tradition with a focus on perfection and innovation. The brewing team produces approximately 3000 kegs, or 46,500 gallons of beer annually. Our brewers supply TAPS in Brea, Corona and Irvine, as well as our sister restaurants, The Catch in Anaheim and Lillie’s Q in Brea Downtown. TAPS also distributes fine beers to restaurants and pubs throughout Southern California. We have received national and international acclaim for barrel-aging programs, which produce cult classics such as Remy’s Pappy.

We source the finest ingredients from around the world and utilize the best brewing procedures to create truly great beer: “World Class in Every Glass.” The hops and barley are meticulously sourced in order to emulate the fine beers and brewing regions of the world.  We utilize proprietary strains of yeast, reverse osmosis filtration, and tailor our water chemistry and processes every time beer is made.

TAPS’ passion for perfection has been recognized on the regional, state, national and international levels—to date we have received over 87 medals for our fine beers. TAPS barrel-aged products have also garnered national and international acclaim and are treasured by collectors worldwide

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

data.name: Kölsch
data.description: A refreshingly cool german ale.  Brewed with a pale barley malt with a touch of wheat and the special german yeast to create a unique delightful flavor perfect for lazy summer days.

breweries.name: High Desert Brewing Co.
breweries.description: After years of recipe development, remodeling, and parking lot paving, the High Desert Brewing Co. opened it's doors in July of 1997 and has quickly become one of New Mexico's premier brewpubs. Our selection of hand crafted lagers and ales are produced on premises using the finest grains and hops. We brew small batches of about 100 gallons, ensuring that each beer is served at the peak of freshness. Our brews are available by the glass, pint, or pitcher and to-go in 1/2 gallon growlers and 5 gallon kegs. We make every attempt to keep all of our beers on tap at all times but once in a while one or two may not be available for a few days. These times are the perfect opportunity to stretch your taste and try something other than your favorite. Please let Bob or Donna, or any of the High Desert Brewing Co. staff know how you think we are doing.
